Teammate 6: Both jellyfish and octopuses have the ability to regenerate lost limbs. If a jellyfish loses a tentacle, it can regrow it over time. Similarly, if an octopus loses an arm, it will grow back through a process called regeneration.

Teammate 7: Both jellyfish and octopuses are excellent swimmers and are capable of moving in a variety of directions using their tentacles. They can also squeeze through small openings and crevices in their environment.

Teammate 8: Both jellyfish and octopuses have unique ways of communicating with other members of their species. Jellyfish release chemical signals into the water to attract mates, while octopuses use visual displays and body postures to communicate with each other.
